channel.title: Cloud-Resume on Jeff Glass
channel.description: Recent content in Cloud-Resume on Jeff Glass

item.title: Auto-Generated YouTube Thumbnails
item.description: One thing I'd like to have for both my Demilight project page and the homepage is an automatically generated gallery of thumbnails of my recent YouTube uploads, either from a specific playlist or from all of my uploads.

item.title: Dockerfiles
item.description: I'm setting out to rectify a pretty silly part of my workflow.

item.title: Mobile Friendly Design
item.description: The site's coming along well now! But there's just one small problem - specifically, how the site looks on mobile devices, or even just devices smaller than fullscreen.

item.title: Porting Wordpress Blogs to Hugo
item.description: As the site gains more and more content, it seems like it's only a matter of time before I port my previous blog(s) over to the Hugo framework that I'm enjoying so much.

item.title: Removing the Default Theme
item.description: At this point, I feel I have the theming and functionality of hugo pretty well in hand.

item.title: Page Bundles and Image Processing
item.description: As I figure out my workflow for creating pages, especially the "

item.title: Javascript Beginnings
item.description: I've written very little Javascript up to this point, but now I've found a use case for some.

item.title: Refactoring the Site
item.description: At this point, I transitioned between a couple of different computers; in fact, I'm likely to be bouncing back and forth between two and even 3 computers over the course of this project.

item.title: Hugo
item.description: Since I've been using npm for the other parts of this project, I wanted to see if there was a straightforward way to install the Hugo static site generator with npm.

item.title: Content with HTML, CSS
item.description: Now that I have the barebones of a publication workflow going, it'd be nice if there was something to actually look at on this new site.

item.title: Visitor Counter with JS, Lambda, and DynamoDB
item.description: I've been spending a lot of shower-thoughts on what the actual content of my resume page should be.

item.title: GitHub for Frontend
item.description: From an outside perspective, it seems that one of the goals of the Cloud Resume Challenge is to introduce new pracitioners to tools that will make their lives easier in developing future projects.

item.title: Custom Domain
item.description: Since I already have a custom domain at jeff.glass (which is likely where you're reading this, if you're reading this around the time of posting), I'd like to figure out how to point a subdomain of that site at my nascent Cloudfront/S3 static site.

item.title: Cloudfront for HTTPs
item.description: To a layman's eye, using AWS Cloudfront to enable HTTPs on a website seems like using a bazooka to blast a butterfly - massively overkill with far more power than necessary.

item.title: Getting Started with AWS
item.description: I'm always looking for ways to expand my skillset, and in an increasingly digital, work-from-home oriented world, having a firmer grasp on web technologies seems like not a bad thing.
